intro: Emelianthe panganensis subsp. panganensis, commonly known as the Panganen Island emelianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
